Package jnet

Class Header

java.lang.Object
jnet.Header
public class Header extends Object
Utilities to handle header generation, application, and verification for socket buffer safety. The inclusion of fixed-size headers with CRC redundancy allows a specific payload length to be read, assuming the integrity of the header. Upon header corruption, other tactics (e.g. sequence numbers and resends) can be used to verify data transmission.

Throughout the methods within this class, the following notation is used to refer to data contained in byte arrays:

  • header - a header to allow for safe data I/O. See jnet.Header.
  • payload - a byte array containing the data being sent or received through the socket. This is what is ultimately expected by the programmer and is the only component of the message returned by the send/recv methods of the socket-oriented classes in this library.
  • crc - a 4-byte checksum of payload. The argument to the method CRC::crc32() is referred to as bytes to provide a more generic name, but this method is almost exclusively used to generate a checksum for payload.
  • body - a byte array containing payload + crc in that order.
  • message - the full message sent across the socket, comprised of header + body in that order.

The header managed by this class is defined as a byte array containing the following (see documention/Networking-Lib-Specification.docx for more information):

Bytes
Byte Commentary
b[0] Header identifier, always 0x68 ("h").
b[1] Reserved (sequence number).
b[3, 2] unused
b[7, 4] Body length. Defined as (payload + crc).length == body.length.
b[11, 8] Header CRC. This is a checksum only for b[0, 7] in the header. The body is assumed to contain its own checksum if needed.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • attach

      public static byte[] attach(byte[] body)
      Creates and attaches a header to the argument body. A new byte array is returned containing header + body in that order. The contents of body are not modified. This method will validate the crc of the payload and return null if the crc is invalid.
      Parameters:
      body - the message body (which must contain a crc) to generate and attach a header to
      Returns:
      a new array containing header + body in that order.

    • validateAndParse

      public static Header.Info validateAndParse(byte[] header)
      Validates and parses the content of a given header as a Header.Info object. "Validation" includes a check of the header crc. Upon any validation error null is returned and an error is logged. If the validation succeeds (Header::validateAndParse() != null), the data in the struct is guaranteed to be valid.
      Parameters:
      header - the header to validate.
      Returns:
      a Header.Info struct containing all the information of the header in more accessible public instance variables.
      See Also:
      • Header.Info
      • Log
